message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CR

The paper discusses a novel method for approximating the specialty of a given publication record by combining key values from four data fields: source, title, authors, and references. This method is founded on concepts defining research disciplines and scholarly communication, which are relevant to several sub-categories in computer science. The paper also provides an illustration of the method using publication records of individual scientists, which suggests that the approach could be applied to various specialized publication records. Based on this information, the most likely sub-categories for this paper are cs.DL (Digital Libraries), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.CY (Computers and Society), and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
